player.name: Thierry Henry
player.description: Henry arrived from Juventus on 3rd August 1999 to Arsenal for an estimated fee of £11 million, reuniting with his former manager Arsène Wenger. One of Henry’s most successful seasons was in 2003/04 when Arsenal were determined to reclaim the Barclays Premier League crown. Henry was instrumental in Arsenal's exceptionally successful campaign. Henry ensured that the Gunners became the first team in more than a century to go through the entire domestic league season unbeaten, claiming the title in the process.

data.key: 99 international PFA Player of the Year

player.name: Dennis Bergkamp
player.description: Bergkamp left Internazionale and signed with Arsenal in June 1995 for a transfer fee estimated at £7.5 million. In the 2001/02 season Bergkamp played in 33 league matches, setting up 15 goals. In the same year, Arsenal regained the Barclays Premier League title, beating Manchester United at Old Trafford in the penultimate game of the season to complete the Club's second double under Wenger. Arsenal defeated Chelsea 2–0 to win the FA Cup. Bergkamp reached a personal landmark during the 2002/03 season, scoring his 100th goal for Arsenal against Oxford United.

data.key: World Top Goal Scorer of the Year
Premier League Goal of the Season
PFA and FWA Player of the Year

player.name: Tony Adams
player.description: Adams signed for Arsenal as a schoolboy in 1980 and 3 years later made his first team debut on 5th November. Adams was part of the "famous four" that lined up in Arsenal's defence, which was renowned for its well-disciplined use of the offside trap. On 1st January 1988, he became Arsenal captain at the age of 21; he would remain Club captain for the next 14 years until his retirement

data.key: PFA Young Player of the Year

player.name: David Seaman
player.description: Arsenal’s manager George Graham signed Seaman for £1.3 million (at the time a British record for a goalkeeper)..Seaman's time at Arsenal coincided with one of the most successful periods in the Club's history. The 1990/91 season saw Seaman concede only 18 goals when playing in every match of the 38-game season, as Arsenal regained the League title. Arsenal won both the FA Cup and the League Cup in 1993 and supplemented this a year later with the European Cup Winners' Cup.

player.name: Jack Wilshere
player.description: Wilshere came up through Arsenal Youth Academy and was given the number 19 shirt in the first- team squad for season 2008/09. He became the Club’s youngest league debutant against Blackburn Rovers in September 2008 at the age of 16. His breakthrough season at the Club was 2010/11 when he was voted the Player of the season.

data.key: PFA Young player of the Year award

item.description: Opened in 2006, Emirates Stadium is one of the newest stadia in the Barclays Premier League. The stadium was built on a former waste disposal site in Ashburton Grove and Emirates Airline were named as the main sponsor of the ground in 2004. The stadium’s site takes up around 17 acres and is incredibly advanced, there is constant computer monitoring of the stadiums conditions to ensure the pitch is always the highest quality possible.

statistics.description:
Capacity: 60,362

Field Dimensions: 105m x 68m

Surface: Desso GrassMaster.
